ground_truth: The Beast's journey takes it past a dangling fish hook baited with worms, past a tempting lure sparkling in the sun, and past a swiping bear claw. The Beast isn't worried. Will Bloom, age 3, listens wide-eyed as his father, Edward Bloom, in his 40s and handsome, tells the story. In every gesture, Edward is bigger than life, describing each detail with absolute conviction. A few years later, Will sits with the other Indian Guides as Edward continues telling the story to the tribe, pointing to his wedding band glinting in the firelight. While the other boys are rapt with attention, Will looks bored. Edward is chatting up Will's pretty date to the homecoming dance. She is enjoying the story and the force of Edward's charisma. He's hypnotizing. Will, now 17 with braces, is fuming and ready to leave. His mother Sandra, from whom he gets his good looks and practicality, stands with him at the door. She looks gorgeous and couldn't be any happier if it were her own wedding. Will can't take any more. Josephine tries to hold him back, but he gets up and leaves. As he leaves, Will mutters in perfect unison with his father. Will reaches the door, where his mother intercepts him. He focuses his words on Sandra. A laugh comes from the crowd. Edward motions for Sandra to join him. As she crosses, we can see that thirty years of marriage has not lessened their affection for each other. As they kiss, Edward tweaks her chin in a special little way. The crowd applauds. Edward toasts the happy couple. Josephine covers well for her absent husband, with a smile as warm as summer. We come into the middle of an argument on the sidewalk. Both men are a little drunk. A long beat, then. Will won't let him get the last word. Angle on Edward, who waves a hand, signaling enough of you, before he walks away. Angle on Will, still fuming with righteous anger. On a typically busy day, Will is on hold with the phone cradled under an ear, sorting through a bundle of mail dropped on his desk. Returning to the mail, he finds a hand-addressed envelope and rips it open. At the table, Sandra talks on the phone while Edward fixes a sandwich. Edward takes a seat and starts to eat his sandwich as Sandra stands by the window, watching. Edward swims laps in the family pool, born to the water. Edward stares intently into the water, like a lion in wait. We look down at the river, where Edward's reflection is caught in the dark water. As the water ripples past, something changes, and sure enough, as we look up again, it's a younger Edward Bloom, in his 20s, staring into the water.

Will Bloom, age 3, listens wide-eyed to his father, Edward Bloom, who is handsome and in his 40s. Edward, larger than life, describes each detail with conviction. Their affection is evident as they kiss, and the crowd applauds. Edward toasts the couple. Josephine covers for Will with a warm smile. We find Will in an argument on the sidewalk. Both men are slightly drunk, and Will refuses to let Edward have the last word. Edward signals "enough" and walks away, leaving Will fuming. On a busy day, Will is on hold, sorting mail on his desk. He finds a hand-addressed envelope and opens it. Sandra talks on the phone as Edward makes a sandwich. Edward sits to eat while Sandra watches by the window. Edward, born to the water, swims laps in the pool. He stares into the water, like a lion in wait. As the river ripples, Edward's reflection reveals a younger Edward in his 20s.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description:
The journey of the Beast unfolds as it moves past a dangling fish hook, expertly baited with juicy worms, past an enticing lure that sparkles mesmerizingly in the brilliant sunlight, and past the menacing swipe of a bear claw. Yet, the Beast remains completely unperturbed and unfazed. Meanwhile, young Will Bloom, who is only 3 years old, listens with wide, curious eyes as his father, Edward Bloom, a man in his 40s and undeniably handsome, weaves the tale with vivid imagery. With every expressive gesture, Edward appears larger than life itself, narrating each exquisite detail with the utmost conviction. 

As a few years go by, Will finds himself sitting among the other Indian Guides. Edward, ever the storyteller, continues to captivate the tribe with the ongoing saga, all the while pointing to his wedding band, which catches the firelight with an enchanting gleam. While the other boys are riveted with awe and attention, Will appears indifferent, even bored. Meanwhile, Edward is charming Will’s attractive date to the homecoming dance with his tale, and she is thoroughly enjoying both the story and the magnetic pull of Edward's charisma. He's utterly hypnotizing, a force of nature. Now at 17 and sporting braces, Will is simmering with frustration, visibly upset and ready to leave. His mother, Sandra, from whom he inherits his good looks and practical nature, stands beside him at the door. She looks stunningly beautiful and couldn't possibly be happier, as if she were at her own wedding. Will can't bear it any longer. Although Josephine tries to restrain him, he stands up and heads out. As Will departs, he mutters the words in perfect synchronization with his father. 

As he reaches the door, his mother intercepts him, capturing his distracted attention. A laugh resonates from the assembled crowd. Edward gestures for Sandra to join him, and as she crosses the room, it's evident that the affection between them has not dwindled in thirty years of marriage. As they unite in a loving kiss, Edward tweaks her chin in that endearing, special way. The crowd breaks into applause. Edward raises a toast to the happy couple, acknowledging them in celebration. Josephine, with a smile as warm as a summer's day, covers well for her absent husband. We find ourselves witnessing the middle of an argument on the sidewalk. Both men, slightly inebriated, exchange words. There is a long pause, and then, Will refuses to allow his father to have the last word. The camera shifts to focus on Edward, who dismissively waves a hand as if to signal "enough of you," before turning to walk away. The angle returns to Will, who remains seething with righteous anger.

On a typically bustling day, Will finds himself on hold, with the telephone cradled efficiently under his ear as he sorts through a pile of mail that has been delivered to his desk. As he returns to focus on the mail, his eyes land on a hand-addressed envelope, which he promptly rips open. Meanwhile, at the table, Sandra is engaged in a phone conversation while Edward methodically prepares a sandwich. Edward then takes a seat and begins to enjoy his meal as Sandra stands by the window, observing the scene outside. In another moment, Edward is seen swimming laps in the family pool, as if born to the water, moving with the grace of a natural swimmer. With an intense gaze, Edward stares into the water with the focus of a lion awaiting its prey. Our view shifts downward to the river, where we catch a glimpse of Edward's reflection mirrored in the dark water. As the water ripples gently by, a transformation occurs, and when we look up once more, we see a younger Edward Bloom, in his 20s, gazing thoughtfully into the water.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description:
The unfolding saga of the Beast takes us on an intriguing and suspense-filled journey as it maneuvers past a fish hook hanging enticingly in the air, expertly baited with a generous helping of juicy, wriggling worms. The scene continues as it glides by an alluring lure that twinkles and sparkles mesmerizingly in the brilliant, radiant sunlight, and further on, past the menacing swipe of a formidable bear claw, all the while remaining entirely unperturbed and remarkably unfazed by these potential threats. At the same time, young Will Bloom, who is merely 3 years old, listens with wide, wonder-filled eyes as his father, Edward Bloom, a distinguished man in his 40s and undeniably handsome, skillfully weaves the tale rich with vivid imagery and striking detail. Every expressive gesture adds to Edward's persona as someone larger than life itself, narrating every exquisite detail with boundless conviction and enthusiasm.

As time progresses and a few years slip by, Will finds himself sitting among the group of other Indian Guides. Edward, ever the captivating storyteller, continuously enchants and captivates the tribe with the ongoing saga. Infusing every word with vibrant life, he casually gestures to his wedding band, which catches the firelight with its enchanting gleam. While the other boys remain utterly absorbed, hanging onto every word with rapt attention, Will appears indifferent, his demeanor bordering on bored. Meanwhile, Edward is charmingly engaging Will’s lovely date to the homecoming dance, weaving his tale with such charisma that she thoroughly enjoys both the story and the overwhelming magnetic pull of Edward's vibrant personality. He is truly hypnotizing, like a force of nature. Now at 17 and still sporting braces, Will finds himself simmering with frustration, visibly upset and clearly ready to leave. His mother, Sandra, from whom he inherited his striking good looks and practical nature, stands beside him at the door. She looks stunningly beautiful, radiating happiness as if she were at her own wedding. Will's patience reaches its limit. Despite Josephine's attempts to restrain him, he stands abruptly and makes his way out. As Will departs, he mutters the words in perfect synchronization with his father, echoing the tale.

As Will approaches the door, his mother intercepts him, capturing his distracted attention for a brief moment. A soft laugh resonates through the gathered crowd. Edward gestures invitingly for Sandra to join him, and as she elegantly crosses the room, it's evident to all that the affection between them has not dwindled in the thirty years of their marriage. As they unite in a loving, tender kiss, Edward playfully tweaks her chin in that endearing and special way they share. The crowd erupts into applause. Edward raises his glass in a celebratory toast to the happy couple, acknowledging them with warmth and good humor. Josephine, with a smile as warm and welcoming as a summer's day, smoothly covers for her absent husband. We then find ourselves witnessing the middle of an argument on the bustling sidewalk. Both men, slightly inebriated, exchange words in a heated moment. There is a prolonged pause, and then Will, determined not to let his father have the final word, interjects with conviction. The camera shifts its focus to Edward, who dismissively waves his hand, signaling "enough of you," before turning his back to walk away. The angle then returns to Will, who remains seething, his righteous anger palpable.

On a typically bustling day, Will finds himself on hold, with the telephone cradled efficiently under his ear as he sorts through a pile of mail delivered to his desk. As he returns to focusing on the mail, his gaze lands on a hand-addressed envelope, which he promptly and eagerly rips open. Meanwhile, across the room, Sandra is engaged in a phone conversation, while Edward methodically prepares a sandwich. Afterward, Edward takes a seat and begins to enjoy his meal, as Sandra stands by the window, watching the scene outside unfold. In another moment, Edward is seen swimming laps in the family pool, moving through the water with the grace of a natural-born swimmer, as if the water is his true element. With an intense gaze, Edward stares into the water, focused like a lion awaiting its prey. Our view shifts downward to the river, allowing us to catch a fleeting glimpse of Edward's reflection mirrored in the dark, mysterious water. As the water ripples gently by, a magical transformation occurs, and when we look up once more, we see a younger version of Edward Bloom, in his 20s, gazing thoughtfully and contemplatively into the water below.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: The Beast embarks on its journey, moving steadily past a dangling fish hook glistening with worms, and it continues further to bypass a glittering lure that sparkles enticingly in the sun, eventually avoiding a bear's claw swiping through the air. Throughout this elaborate journey, the Beast remains unconcerned. Meanwhile, three-year-old Will Bloom listens intently, his eyes wide with wonder as his father, Edward Bloom, who is in his forties and strikingly handsome, narrates the story. Edward animates each gesture with grandeur, delivering each detail with unwavering certainty. Fast forward a few years, Will finds himself alongside other Indian Guides, seated attentively as Edward resumes weaving the tale to the gathered tribe, accentuating his narrative by pointing to his wedding band, which catches the flickering firelight. While the other boys are captivated, Will appears indifferent. As Edward continues, he skillfully engages in conversation with Will's attractive date for the upcoming homecoming dance, and she appears charmed by both the story and Edward's compelling charisma, enchanted by his presence. Will, now a 17-year-old sporting braces, grows increasingly frustrated, seething with anger and contemplating his departure. His mother, Sandra, who has passed on her good looks and practical nature to him, stands beside him at the doorway, exuding elegance and radiating happiness as if it were her wedding day. Unable to tolerate the situation any longer, Will decides to leave, despite Josephine's attempts to restrain him, but he brushes past her and exits anyway. As Will departs, he echoes his father's words in perfect harmony. He reaches the threshold where his mother intercepts him, and he directs his words pointedly toward Sandra. A ripple of laughter emanates from the crowd, and Edward gestures for Sandra to come over to him. As she crosses the room, it's evident that thirty years of marriage have only deepened their affection, made visible as Edward playfully tweaks her chin in a unique and endearing manner as they kiss, drawing applause from the crowd. Edward then raises a glass in a toast to celebrate the happy couple. Josephine compensates seamlessly for Will’s absence, her smile as radiant as a summer day. The scene transitions to an ongoing argument on the sidewalk, where both men, slightly intoxicated, exchange words. After a prolonged pause, Will refuses to concede the last word. The scene shifts with a focus on Edward, who dismissively waves a hand signaling enough before he strides away. Will, still simmering with righteous indignation, remains in place. On an ordinary bustling day, Will juggles a phone call while balancing the receiver under his ear, simultaneously sifting through a stack of mail freshly delivered to his desk. Amidst the routine sorting, he discovers a hand-addressed envelope that captures his attention, prompting him to tear it open with curiosity. Meanwhile, at a dining table, Sandra conducts a phone conversation as Edward constructs a sandwich. Once assembled, Edward takes a seat and begins to eat while Sandra stands vigil by the window, observing the scene. Later, Edward immerses himself in the family pool, executing lap after lap, demonstrating his affinity for the water. He gazes intently at the water's surface, akin to a lion poised in wait. Our perspective shifts downward, focusing on the river where Edward's reflection is etched into the dark, flowing water. As the water’s ripples distort the reflection, a transformation occurs and, when we look up again, it is a younger Edward Bloom in his twenties who now stares contemplatively into the water.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: The Beast navigates past various obstacles, showing no fear, as Will Bloom, age 3, listens in awe to his father, Edward Bloom. Edward, charismatic and larger than life, vividly narrates the tale. Years later, Will, now an Indian Guide, listens with the others as Edward captivates the group, though Will appears disinterested. Edward engages Will's homecoming date with his storytelling, while Will, now 17 and sporting braces, grows frustrated and prepares to leave the lively scene. Sandra, Will’s mother, shares in the celebration, showing enduring affection with Edward, as the crowd applauds their bond. Josephine smoothly handles Will's absence, covering for him with a warm smile. On the sidewalk, an argument with Edward leaves Will seething. During a busy day, Will juggles a phone call and mail sorting, discovering a significant hand-addressed letter. Meanwhile, Sandra converses by phone as Edward makes a sandwich, later taking a swim, embodying comfort in water. As Edward gazes into the pool with lion-like intent, a transformation reveals a younger Edward Bloom reflected in the water.

As he leaves, Will mutters in perfect unison with his father, a testament to how well he knows Edward's stories. Will reaches the door, where his mother intercepts him. He focuses his words on Sandra. A laugh comes from the crowd, lightening the mood. Edward motions for Sandra to join him. As she crosses, we can see that thirty years of marriage has not lessened their affection for each other, a rarity that many admire. As they kiss, Edward tweaks her chin in a special little way, a tender gesture they've shared since their courtship. The crowd applauds. Edward toasts the happy couple, his charm eliciting smiles all around. Josephine covers well for her absent husband, with a smile as warm as summer, known for her ability to maintain grace in social settings. We come into the middle of an argument on the sidewalk in front of their home. Both men are a little drunk, from celebrating, perhaps. A long beat, then. Will won't let him get the last word, his pride not allowing him. Angle on Edward, who waves a hand, signaling enough of you, a dismissive gesture that stings. before he walks away. Angle on Will, still fuming with righteous anger, a reflection of their complicated relationship. On a typically busy day in his office, Will is on hold with the phone cradled under an ear, sorting through a bundle of mail dropped on his desk by the morning courier. Returning to the mail, he finds a hand-addressed envelope, a rarity in the digital age, and rips it open. At the table, Sandra talks on the phone, remaining the family's social hub, while Edward fixes a sandwich, his culinary skills modest but satisfying. Edward takes a seat and starts to eat his sandwich as Sandra stands by the window, watching the world outside with a reflective gaze. Edward swims laps in the family pool, a favorite pastime of his, born to the water. Edward stares intently into the water, like a lion in wait, reflecting his predatory focus. We look down at the river, where Edward's reflection is caught in the dark water. As the water ripples past, something changes, and sure enough, as we look up again, it's a younger Edward Bloom, in his 20s and full of ambition, staring into the water.

A few years later Will sits with the other Indian Guides as Edward continues telling the story to the tribe pointing to his wedding band glinting in the firelight. While the other boys are rapt with attention Will looks bored. Edward is chatting up Will's pretty date to the homecoming dance. She is enjoying the story and the force of Edward's charisma. He is hypnotizing. Will now 17 with braces is fuming and ready to leave. His mother Sandra from whom he gets his good looks and practicality stands with him at the door. She looks gorgeous and could not be any happier if it were her own wedding. Will cannot take any more. Josephine tries to hold him back but he gets up and leaves. As he leaves Will mutters in perfect unison with his father. Will reaches the door where his mother intercepts him. He focuses his words on Sandra. A laugh comes from the crowd. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. his every desperate step a race against time to save lives in the midst of utter devastation. On a sundappled afternoon in a quaint European village an eccentric inventor unveils a groundbreaking contraption that defies conventional physics igniting wonder and skepticism in equal measure. In a bustling marketplace in ancient Persia a cunning street thief navigates labyrinthine alleyways and vibrant bazaars. his calculated every move a daring escape from the everwatchful royal guards. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Edward motions for Sandra to join him. As she crosses we can see that thirty years of marriage has not lessened their affection for each other. As they kiss Edward tweaks her chin in a special little way. The crowd applauds. Edward toasts the happy couple. Josephine covers well for her absent husband with a smile as warm as summer. We come into the middle of an argument on the sidewalk. Both men are a little drunk. A long beat then Will will not let him get the last word. Angle on Edward who waves a hand signaling enough of you before he walks away. Angle on Will still fuming with righteous anger. On a typically busy day Will is on hold with the phone cradled under an ear sorting through a bundle of mail dropped on his desk. Returning to the mail he finds a handaddressed envelope and rips it open. At the table Sandra talks on the phone. while Edward fixes a sandwich. Edward takes a seat and starts to eat his sandwich. as Sandra stands by the window watching Edward swims laps in the family pool born to the water. Edward stares intently into the water like a lion in wait. We look down at the river where Edward's reflection is caught in the dark water. As the water ripples past something changes and sure enough as we look up again it is a younger Edward Bloom in his 20s staring into the water.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: The Owl's expedition takes it beyond a swinging feather orbited with bees, beyond a curious fragrance shimmering in the rain, and beyond a sliding snake coil. The Owl isn't nervous. Jenny Lake, age 5, observes wide-eyed as her uncle, Sam Lake, in his 60s and charming, narrates the legend. In every motion, Sam is grander than imagination, painting each scene with utter confidence. A decade later, Jenny huddles with the other Forest Scouts as Sam continues illustrating the tale to the assembly, gesturing to his wristband sparkling in the moonlight. While the other kids are transfixed, Jenny seems uninterested. Sam is engaging Jenny's dashing escort to the lunar festival. He is captivated by the tale and the aura of Sam's charisma. He's mesmerizing. Jenny, now 19 with glasses, is seething and eager to escape. Her aunt Helen, from whom she inherits her elegance and wit, stands beside her at the portal. She looks radiant and couldn't be any prouder if it were her own gathering. Jenny can't endure it further. Alex tries to restrain her, but she rises and exits. As she departs, Jenny mumbles in perfect synchronization with her uncle. Jenny reaches the threshold, where her aunt intercepts her. She sharpens her words on Helen. A chuckle erupts from the gathering. Sam gestures for Helen to accompany him. As she moves across, we observe that three decades of companionship has not diminished their fondness for each other. As they embrace, Sam nudges her arm in a distinctive little manner. The audience cheers. Sam salutes the joyful pair. Alex compensates well for her absent friend, with a grin as bright as sunrise. We move into the heart of a debate on the avenue. Both individuals are slightly tipsy. A brief pause, then. Jenny won't allow him the concluding phrase. Focus on Sam, who flicks a wrist, suggesting enough of this, before he strides away. Focus on Jenny, still boiling with indignant fervor. On a typically bustling afternoon, Jenny is on pause with the radio cushioned under a shoulder, sifting through a heap of parcels thrown on her counter. Returning to the parcels, she discovers a hand-marked package and tears it apart. At the counter, Helen chats on the radio while Sam assembles a burger. Sam claims a position and starts to munch on his burger as Helen stands by the entrance, observing. Sam dives circuits in the family tub, destined for the liquid. Sam gazes intensely into the liquid, like a tiger in wait. We peer down at the stream, where Sam's shadow is captured in the murky current. As the current undulates past, something alters, and sure enough, as we glance up again, it's a youthful Sam Lake, in his 30s, gazing into the liquid.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: The Beast moves past various temptations, but remains undeterred. Three-year-old Will Bloom listens, fascinated, as his father, Edward Bloom, recounts the tale with grandeur and conviction. Years later, Edward's storytelling captivates others, but Will grows bored. At 17, Will leaves a gathering in frustration as Edward charms Will's date. His mother, Sandra, tries to console him. Despite their long marriage, Sandra and Edward still share a strong affection, delighting the crowd with a kiss. Will argues with Edward outside, both slightly drunk, leaving Will fuming. Later, Will discovers a letter among his mail. Meanwhile, Edward lives his life, enjoying simple pleasures like fixing a sandwich, swimming, and reflecting by the water. In his reflection, Edward appears younger, capturing his timeless essence.
